greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (a(n-1) + p(n)) mod p(n+1).
comment: Differences when decreasing are essentially A001223, so increases occur when primes being used are roughly double those at previous increase; e.g. a(3352)=(12+31123)mod 31139=31135 and a(6257)=(1+62273)mod 62297=62274 - _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 13 2003
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
results.author: _Jon Perry_, May 28 2003
ext: Definition clarified by _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 13 2016
